etymologies: mid 18th century (originally in nautical use): of unknown origin

definitions: a short rod of wood or plastic sewn to one side of a coat or other garment, pushed through a hole or loop on the other side and twisted so as to act as a fastener.
shortDefinitions: short rod of wood or plastic sewn to one side of coat or other garment, pushed through hole or loop on other side and twisted so as to act as fastener

definitions: a pin or other crosspiece put through the eye of a rope or a link of a chain to keep it in place.
shortDefinitions: pin or other crosspiece put through eye of rope or link of chain

definitions: a kind of wall fastener for use on hollow walls, having a part that springs open or turns through 90° after it is inserted so as to prevent withdrawal.
shortDefinitions: kind of wall fastener for use on open-backed plasterboard

definitions: a movable pivoted crosspiece acting as a barb on a harpoon.
shortDefinitions: movable pivoted crosspiece acting as barb on harpoon

definitions: a key or command that toggles between two modes, such as the caps lock key.
shortDefinitions: key or command that is operated same way but with opposite effect on successive occasions

definitions: switch from one effect, feature, or state to another by using a toggle

examples.text: the play/pause button toggles between those functions
there are a number of attributes which can be toggled on or off

shortDefinitions: switch from one effect, feature, or state to another by using toggle

definitions: provide or fasten with a toggle or toggles

examples.text: our horses were hobbled or toggled before they were turned out to graze

shortDefinitions: provide or fasten with toggle or toggles
